name: Zhang, Letian

details.subtitle: eBay APD Shanghai
details.description: Work on intranet solutions about sharing data analysis reports, which is based on Joomla! CMS with the addition of much customization. During the internship, I created a web app for monitoring system CRON jobs besides daily development and maintenance. I also have learned Joomla! Platform in deep, wrote some codes for contributions to Joomla! community, got familiar with Scrum teamwork, and improved understanding of large-scale web system.

details.subtitle: Querying website of “P.E. Clock In”
details.description: “P.E. Clock In” is a factor to students' P.E. course scores. I hacked into OA system of P.E. department by chance and created the web app for querying every student's own counts, which uses PHP as back-end and jQuery as front-end. There were about 150,000 query requests and 250,000 UV per semester, which means almost every student had used this web app.

details.subtitle: Internet Dial-in Utility in Campus
details.description: Every student in campus must be authenticated by user name, password and CAPTCHA before connecting to the Internet. I designed and implemented a daemon utility that can substitute for manual login as well as solving the CAPTCHA image. It’s completed with wxPython so the cross-platform compatibility is good. One week after the beta version released, there are 700 logins using my tool every day.

details.subtitle: Mobile OPAC Web App in Campus
details.description: Because I could not search the library at any time and from anywhere, I developed the mobile version of OPAC in PHP and released to public. There were over 2000 search requests per month at that time.

details.subtitle: 10th Anniversary Celebration Website of Software Institute, Nanjing University
details.description: Majority of my work was focused on front-end with jQuery. The website was built based on HTML5 Boilerplate and used jekyll for generating static website.

details.subtitle: “SweetNS” Social Mashup Web App
details.description: I was the leader of the team and responsible for API consuming development。The project won the “Best Freshman” award of 8th Innovation Competition in my department.
